body.p: Madison based lawyer and Confederate officer. Son of Dr. Edmund R. and Sabrina McCreary. Graduated from Centre College in Danville in 1857. Earned a law degree from Cumberland University in Tennessee in 1859. Practiced law in Richmond, Kentucky. After the Battle of Richmond in August 1862, joined the newly formed Confederate 11th Kentucky Cavalry as a Major. Participated in the Battle of Hartsville and Morgan’s raid in Ohio. Promoted to lieutenant colonel in July 1863. Taken prisoner at the Battle of Buffington Island. Served time in prisons in Cincinnati, Ohio, Fort Delaware, and Morris Island, South Carolina. Released in August 1863 as part of a prisoner exchange. Resumed command of a Confederate battalion in late 1863, and served in that capacity until the end of the war.
